title: Twitter, Disney, Mattel, Twilio, Tesla: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Disney added nearly 12 million subscribers to its streaming service; Mattel reported better-than-expected earnings during the holidays
text:
* Twilio shares gained 15% premarket after the company reported revenue growth in the fourth quarter and issued guidance for the upcoming quarter.

* Uber gained 4.8% premarket. The ride-hailing company's fourth-quarterly revenue climbed, helped by a recovery in its rides business and continued demand for food delivery, despite restaurant reopenings.

* Disney jumped 7.4% after the company said it added nearly 12 million streaming subscriptions and reported record revenue at its domestic parks and resorts.

* Mattel climbed 9.1% premarket after it posted better-than-expected revenue and earnings for the holiday quarter.

* Datadog climbed 12% premarket in the moments after it reported quarterly results.

* Lumen Technologies dropped 13% ahead of the bell, even after it swung to an annual profit last year from a loss in 2020.

* PepsiCo edged down 0.2% premarket. The beverage-and-snacks giant reported fourth-quarter profit and revenue that topped expectations, boosted its dividend and set a new $10 billion stock repurchase program.

* Coca-Cola rose 0.9% premarket after it reported fourth-quarter earnings and revenue that beat expectations.

* Interpublic Group slipped 2.6% after it raised its quarterly dividend and authorized the resumption of the advertising company's share-repurchase program.

* Kellogg added 3.2% after it reported an earnings beat.

* Equifax gained 1.1% premarket. The financial services company's profit was higher in the fourth quarter, with growth at its human resources service business boosting revenue.

* Tesla shed 1.8%. A California regulatory agency said it filed a lawsuit against Tesla, alleging racial discrimination and harassment at the electric-vehicle maker.

* Yelp and Zillow are due to report results after the close.

Chart of the Day

* Who is feeling the price squeeze the most? Here is a demographic breakdown of inflation's impacts.
